author: Ravi Shekhar
comment: Perfect! Does what it's super to do and dies it better than the rest of them at play store.  @Marcus, is there any progress on the iOS app you started on a while back? That will make the app complete as I have to rely on Pacer app for the social experience ( Pacer does not do data sync with Google Fit but does with apple health and has no Android wear support) which is not so good on Android as it is on iOS. Will really appreciate a response.

author: Robert Oliveira
comment: Excited to find this app because it promises to sync data from FitBit and Google Fit to name just a couple of apps/accounts. I have FB and GF authenticated, but steps don't seem to be populating into the app or displaying on my phone (Huawei Watch 2). Also cannot figure out how to access any available options for the watch face (assuming there are any). The issues could also be with the watch since it keeps losing Wi-Fi connectivity. Hoping it's not defective. The steps on my FitBit are greater than what the app is showing, so I still need to figure out what is going on. Other than that this app has an awesome design and is full of information with great potential. Thanks Marcus!

author: Lindsey Schwartz
comment: I really love being able to compete with my friends who have FitBits (I use Google Fit). My only complaint is the frequency with which it gets my data from Google Fit. My sister's FitBit updates constantly throughout the day, but mine only seems to update once at the end. Still a great app that I was missing for the longest time!
title: Love this app!

author: Stewart Martin
comment: So far, I have installed the app and tried to connect both Google Fit and Moves accounts, both separately and one at a time, and I always receive "Error syncing data" message.  Additionally receive  "Error fetching location" when trying to enable location, even though location is enabled in the phone.  I would really like to try the app, if it was actually working.  Edit:gave it a second chance.  Tried to log in with both Facebook and android.  Both told me I had logged in, but I was unable to move on from that screen.

author: Jordan York
comment: Like this app, but sleep has never synced got me, and most recent update broke it on Pixel XL on 7.1.2. All just force crashed, so I uninstalled and re installed, now it won't even connect to my Google account. Hope it will be fixed soon.

author: Joanna Han
comment: The app that I have been searching for - to connect my Fitbit data to Google Fit. Simple interface. One time quick connection between each account of Fithub. The only issue I have is the syncing interval between Fitbit to Fithub - it does not allow manual syncing and it only syncs at the end of the day. So far I have no syncing issue with Fithub to Google Fit.

author: Steve Troletti
comment: Tried it again after a year and a redesign... now I can't logon with Google or facebook.... It looked promising connecting with both Google Fit and Jawbone UP. Once installed it quickly loaded the past history from both Google Fit and Jawbone. After that it barely updated the info from the 2 connected apps. It did once when I rebooted the phone but that was it. Additional reboots did nothing. So far it has been useless as it doesn't update the Jawbone data nor the Google Fit data. ASUS Zenfone 3 ZE552KL on Android 7 with UP3

author: Devin Prince
comment: Just did an 8 mile bike ride with my dog, added it to google fit, and installed fithub to try and compete against my wife who has a Fitbit. It will not add the data from the Google fit account even with the sync permission granted.
title: Refuses to sync with Google Fit

author: Kenneth Warford
comment: App keeps telling it needs to authenticate my FitBit but when I go there it says it is already authenticated. Does this several times a day.

author: Percy Lam
comment: Does what it's needed! Simple, combine different brand devices.  Btw, any chance for me to choose "add up" data from 2 smartwatches instead of "averaging"? Would be great because I want to wear my fitbit for jogging but my Android wear for work :)

author: Greg Smith
comment: Nice interface and if it gets fleshed out to provide all of the missing functionality it'll definitely deserve a better rating. Heart rate data? Nope. Sleep info? Not there. Other sports e.g. cycling? Nope.
title: A decent version 1, version 3? Not so much.

author: Melissa Baatz
comment: So far this seems ok. Wish you could link up friends from other fitness devices and challenge them. For some reason this can't find my location
title: Good

author: Tom Bertram
comment: I will set my steps at 6000 and it changes back to what I guess is a default amount of 8000. Other than that it's a good app.
title: Goals

author: Christen Brad
comment: After choosing a Google account the app would not progress. Uninstalled and reinstalled multiple times with no resolve. I do not with to use my Facebook info. Disappointed.

author: Karen Hill
comment: I cannot get this to pick up my location, so I can't add any local friends. Not happy.

author: Tom McGhan
comment: Eventually uninstalled:  tried for more than a month, but finally got tired of the multiple-times-per-day error messages it generated on my LG G4 running Android v 6.0  Maybe on other hardware/software combos it is better, but for me, no joy.

author: mo on email
comment: Connects to Google fit but not fit bit on my note4.
title: Does not work with fitbit

author: Cazzie
comment: Worked very well until the end of August and hasn't recorded any steps since despite my work and family life involving lots of walking.

author: Charli privado
comment: Does nothing... just gathers ur info and then keeps crashing again and again

author: Tyler Hilliard
comment: Google connection doesn't work, does nothing after accepting permission

author: Michael Scharwath
comment: Started out working great with Moto 360 and Google Fit, but now is not working and has turned into a pain. I'm now looking to replace it.

author: Luis Zayas
comment: No love for Garmin though.
title: Great app... but..

author: Alison Li
comment: Got stuck in the login with G/F page.

author: Jesse Scott
comment: Seems like a nice app, if only I could actually log in. I'm on stock android, Google pixel 2 XL

author: Robbie Safford
comment: Just doesn't work.

author: Chris Rouxel
comment: Good work so far. It would be nice to sync the weight data from Fitbit and display it

author: Euveta Lloyd
comment: Would love to give it a higher rating but it will not connect to my moves app.
Wouldnt let me sync with fitbit
Can't even sign in with Google

author: Nazareth Gayle
comment: It keeps crashing

author: Robert Kaplan
comment: Garbage

author: Delaine Woods
comment: Awesome

author: venkat ram
comment: Wanted something that gets data from Google Ft and Fitbit. This one works fine !! Able to compete with friends on different devices in a single app ! Great Job Dev !!

reply.author: Marcus Vinicius Andreo Gabilheri
reply.content: Hi Venkat, I responded to your email. It should be fixed now.

author: Sarah-louise Riley
comment: I used to really like this app, but now I can't connect Google fit  :-( please fix

reply.author: Marcus Vinicius Andreo Gabilheri
reply.content: I just pushed an update. Version 3.2.0. Could you please try and let me know if works? You will need to link Google fit again since I switched the way the integration works with Google fit.

author: Chris C
comment: Works great with fitbit

author: Shelwyn Becker
comment: Developer responded quickly and is fixing the issue. Thank you!

reply.author: Marcus Vinicius Andreo Gabilheri
reply.content: So... Apparently the problem is caused by the Google Play Services being updated. The Google Play Services app updated to version 9.6.1 and fithub is using 9.4.0. I will be updating the version on fithub and pushing a update soon. Thanks for the report.

title: Google Fit doesn't authenticate

author: Nelly Tan
comment: Google fit doesn't connect :(

reply.author: Marcus Vinicius Andreo Gabilheri
reply.content: So... Apparently the problem is caused by the Google Play Services being updated. The Google Play Services app updated to version 9.6.1 and fithub is using 9.4.0. I will be updating the version on fithub and pushing a update soon. Thanks for the report.

author: Justin Blaty
comment: Can't connect to Google fit

reply.author: Marcus Vinicius Andreo Gabilheri
reply.content: So... Apparently the problem is caused by the Google Play Services being updated. The Google Play Services app updated to version 9.6.1 and fithub is using 9.4.0. I will be updating the version on fithub and pushing a update soon. Thanks for the report.

author: nascent nascentt
comment: Wish Xiaomi would let you support Mi Bands. Great for android wear.
title: Amazing, Wish Xiaomi would let you support Mi Bands

author: Tim Cornell
comment: How do you get it to track sleep though all I use is Google fit and sleep as Android. What sleep apps are available for this or do I have to go buy a wristband

reply.author: Marcus Vinicius Andreo Gabilheri
reply.content: If all you use is Google Fit then the sleep will always be 0. Since the app works with other trackers that do track sleep, I display it anyways,but unfortunately if all you have connected is Google Fit then sleep will always show 0.

title: Awesome app
